body:
This is a thread for players of Pokemon XY and ORAS to discuss the game, exchange friend codes and trade.


I'll start off the discussion;
Which Eeveelution do you guys think is the best and why?
body_tagged:

replies.body:
Vaporeon

I'm just sentimentally attached to Vaporeon because I used it in LeafGreen, and it also makes for an amazing poke by itself, and it amazing HP and Special Attack/Special Defense stats

Too bad nobody uses it ;(

In ORAS, I soft-resetted for Shiny Reshiram + Zekrom.
Reshiram took me 650 soft resets (ish)...
Zekrom took me 1200 soft resets (damn you, Zekrom. Never used you anyways)...

The Reshiram has decent stats, but the Zekrom... .-.
The Zekrom's not even for me though ;d



i can also rek michael in showdown

replies.body: Try playing on play.pokemonshowdown.com. It's a simulator where you don't actually have to train up your Pokemon (you just generate and build the team). It uses almost the exact same aesthetics as a regular online battle in ORAS/XY.

replies.body: I don't have one either. However I've 3 different DSs, each I use for trading/farming in each game. I got a Spiritomb in Platinum because I logged on my Pearl game and just kept capturing my own flag. Also, my Pearl game was a previously owned game in which the first owner had about 200 PalPark events. So then I obtained Pokemon in Platinum that I wouldn't otherwise get without a code or an original Gen 2(?) game.
replies.body_tagged: I don't have one either. However I've 3 different DSs, each I use for trading/farming in each game. I got a Spiritomb in Platinum because I logged on my Pearl game and just kept capturing my own flag. Also, my Pearl game was a previously owned game in which the first owner had about 200 PalPark events. So then I obtained Pokemon in Platinum that I wouldn't otherwise get without a code or an original Gen 2(?) game.

replies.body:
Interesting. My favorite game, personally, is Platinum, so here's my team in that game, since they're statistically the best out of all my games.

  • Torterra
  • Staraptor
  • Luxray
  • Machamp
  • Vaporeon
  • Giratina

My question is: are you for or against the usage of action replays in order to get pokémon to gain levels?

replies.body:
The older pokemon games are much better than some of the newer ones.
The older pokemon games you actually had to try to train your pokemon, the new ones you only have to battle trainers to win.
replies.body_tagged:
The older pokemon games are much better than some of the newer ones.
The older pokemon games you actually had to try to train your pokemon, the new ones you only have to battle trainers to win.

replies.body:
The newer games are way too easy. EXP. share needs to be desperately nerfed.

Games like Pokemon Platinum are those hard-ass games where you actually have to try. I went up against the Pokemon League and lost, and ever since then I've been binge-training...

And I liked the idea of "Challenge Mode" in Pokemon White 2, it actually made the game fun.

replies.body: Why would you not take competitive seriously when it's literally called competitive? That image doesn't show anything other than someone just thinking about the plays they make - which is done in literally a few seconds if you're good at competitive. If they find it fun, I don't see what right you have to call us assholes.
replies.body_tagged: Why would you not take competitive seriously when it's literally called competitive? That image doesn't show anything other than someone just thinking about the plays they make - which is done in literally a few seconds if you're good at competitive. If they find it fun, I don't see what right you have to call us assholes.

replies.body:
There's something called being over-competitive, to the point where your mistakes become their entertainment, and your success become their demise. Obviously, being a competitive player myself, I know that I have to take it seriously, which I do, but some people just step over that fine line between competitive and over-competitive.

Also, when I say assholes, I hope you realize that it only applies to a select few...


sorry for for the confusion lol
replies.body_tagged:
There's something called being over-competitive, to the point where your mistakes become their entertainment, and your success become their demise. Obviously, being a competitive player myself, I know that I have to take it seriously, which I do, but some people just step over that fine line between competitive and over-competitive.

Also, when I say assholes, I hope you realize that it only applies to a select few...


sorry for for the confusion lol
